caseTitle: Shaukat Ali v. Election Commission of Pakistan thr. its Secretary, Islamabad & others
tagline: Section 9(1) of the Election Act 2017 affords women special treatment in the form of provision consciously designed for a society in which several practices depriving women of their legitimate legal rights are commonplace. Article 25(3) of the Constitution unequivocally allows for special provisions to be made for the benefit of women as an exception to the general rule of equal treatment. The right to vote is a very precious right and the safeguards provided in respect of women by Section 9(1) are permissible under Article 25(3) and hence intra vires.
